meanings.definition: A single specimen designated as the type specimen when a new species or subspecies is described.
meanings.sent1: Scientists carefully study holotypes to understand new species.
meanings.sent2: The holotypes of dinosaurs help us learn about ancient creatures.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat mistook the holotypes for toys and played with them.
meanings.sent4: In the world of biology, holotypes are like the celebrities of the animal kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed the holotypes in a special exhibit to showcase rare specimens.

meanings.definition: The original specimen or illustration designated as the type specimen of a species or subspecies when it is first described.
meanings.sent1: The holotypes of the newly discovered flower were carefully preserved for future reference.
meanings.sent2: Botanists use holotypes to accurately identify plant species.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole the holotypes and hid them in its tree nest.
meanings.sent4: In the world of science, holotypes are like the founding documents of a new species.
meanings.sent5: The holotypes stood out in the collection, each one a unique representation of a species.
